Lobby looks grand and fancy, but check-in was super smooth. I had to call them to say Iâ€™d arrive late, or they might theymar a no-show. Whatâ€™s worseâ€¦ I called twice to confirm they checked my WhatsApp, but no one did. So annoying. Inside, photos make it look modern, but the furniture is old sliding doors, cupboards almost falling apart, AC makes loud noises. Shower works fine though. Breakfast was good, they had roti jala with curry really tasty. Very good location, opposite the old post office which is now shops and cafes. Near the train station. Walking distance to the old Dutch street and Tjong A Fie mansion. Old but charming hotel. Might not appeal to those who like the post modern millenial gray minimalism. The rooms are old fashioned and furniture slightly damaged (some kid poked the bed headboard full of holes with a pencil) the best thing about the hotel is that on the left of the lobby near the elevators, there are tiles with fossils preserved in them. Infact there is entire coral reef in those tiles. Utterly beautiful. 10/10

We stayed at Grand Inna for 6 nights because of my uncle's funeral in Petisah. Actually this hotel was my late dad favorite hotel, because it has a small mosque at the back and the location is superb. We have stayed here twice before in 2009 & 2012 before their renovation. It brought back all the fond memories.The staff were supernice, kudos to Pak Rheza, the front desk officer, always tried his best to provide everything. The buffet breakfast was good, I think it was the best buffet breakfast compared to the other 3 or 4 stars hotels in Medan. The hot water wasnt working on the 2nd night, I just needed to inform Pak Rheza and the 2 technicians (Pak Indra & Pak Joko)fixed the prob right away. Pak Pardomuan, Grand Inna staff was also very helpful,cheerful & friendly. He helped us with our bags, luggages & other miscellaneous things. Our flight back to Kuala Lumpur was scheduled at 830am. Bu Parista, the F&B supervisor, packed our breakfast, so we managed to have our breakfast at the airport before boarding. Such a thoughtful and lovely gesture. Our deluxe room consisted of 2 super single beds, very comfy and enough pillows. Aircond worked well. We slept soundly and great water pressure for rainforest hot shower was so comforting too. The housekeeping staff dilligently cleaned our room everyday & sprayed some room parfume so the room smelled nice. My son also loved the swimming pool ( has salty water ) Thank you Grand Inna for the amazing hospitality ğŸ‘ See you again.

I am quite used to rural hotels in Indonesia and city hotels at this price point. Grand hotel which has seen better days. Avoid.

Avoid. First morning, was greeted by a pool of urine outside my door. Feral cats are common in Indonesia, but if they are roaming the fifth floor of your elevator hotel, there is a problem. Someone soaked it up, but they never really cleaned the floor. Traces remained the rest of my stay. When I checked in, the first room had no wifi. Only rooms close to the central elevator hall actually get wifi, and it is slow. Had better internet at small, cheap hotels. Moved to another room which was much noisier but had internet. Turned on the fridge. Came back later it was warm. 9 am the first day (after the cat urine) asked the manager at the desk to swap it out. Came back after lunch and he said it was taken care of. He had done nothing. Still the same fridge. (I knew because it still had the same old trash in it from when I checked in. Clean your fridges.) He insisted housekeeping said it was OK and done. I told him this time he needed to change it. They did. There was frost inside. It worked. Put groceries in. Came back later it was warm. Turns out the wiring to the socket was bad. No power. Moved fridge to the floor and a different outlet and it worked. Housekeeping never cleaned the remaining dust and filth off the refrigerator stand from where it had been sitting. I am quite used to rural hotels in Indonesia and city hotels at this price point. Grand hotel which has seen better days. Avoid.
